text: The Rotunda is a mixed-use property in northern Baltimore, Maryland in the popular neighborhood of Hampden, adjacent to the neighborhoods of  Roland Park, and Wyman Park and near the campus of the Johns Hopkins University.
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: The property features retail, office, and residential components including: 150,000 f² of retail space, 140,000 f² of office space, 379 apartments and over 1100 off-street parking spaces, including a multi-level parking garage.
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: Office tenants at The Rotunda include:
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: The Baltimore iHeartMedia studios for WPOC 93.1, WZFT Z104.3, WQSR 102.7 Jack FM and WCAO Heaven
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: 600 AM are on the third floor.
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: The Space Telescope Science Institute.
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: The rest of the office's house lawyers, dentists, sports physicians, a dyslexia tutoring program, mental health professionals and various other specialists.
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: The mall was originally developed by Bernard Manekin who converted the 1921 Maryland Casualty Insurance Co. building, designed by Otto Simonson, into a shopping center in 1971.
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: The historic building's centerpiece is a bell tower which chimes the Westminster Quarters.
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: It was renovated in 2002, and again in 2014 by Hekemian &
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: Co. The mall was bought by Hekemian & Co., Inc. in the early 2000s.
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: The Rotunda was the home to the popular reduced price cinema "The Rotunda Cinematheque" until July 2015.
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: Hekemian & Co is nearing completion of its $100 million redevelopment of the site, which include the 379 unit ICON residences at The Rotunda, shops and restaurants, and a "Mom's Organic Market".
title: The Rotunda (Baltimore)

text: Its studios are located at The Rotunda shopping center in Baltimore, and the transmitter is based atop Television Hill in the city's Woodberry district.
title: WZFT

text: Its transmitter is located in Pikesville, next to the Pikesville Reservoir, and its studios are located at The Rotunda shopping center in Baltimore.
title: WQSR

text: Inc.  The studios and offices are at The Rotunda Shopping Center, on West 40th Street, in Baltimore.
title: WPOC
